dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S518 IS: H2O Visa for Seafood Processing Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Begich introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To authorize the issuance of H2O nonimmigrant visas for aliens temporarily performing labor in the seafood processing industry.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the H2O Visa for Seafood Processing Act.

section.header: Availability of H2O nonimmigrant visas for seafood processing industry

subsection.header: Technical amendments; availability of H2O nonimmigrant visas for aliens working in seafood processing industry
subsection.text: Section 101(a)(15)(H) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(15)(H)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking an alien (i) (b) subject and inserting the following “an alien—
in subclause (b1), by striking section 212(t)(1), or and inserting section 212(t)(1);; and
in subclause (c), by striking or at the end; and
in subclause (a), by striking nature, or and inserting nature;;
in subclause (b), by striking or at the end; and
by adding at the end the following:

subclause.text: having a residence in a foreign country, which the alien has no intention of abandoning, who is coming temporarily to the United States to perform labor in the seafood processing industry; or

subsection.text: Section 212(a)(5)(A) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1182(a)(5)(A)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i), by striking Attorney General and inserting Secretary of Homeland Security; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: The Secretary of Labor may not make a certification under clause (i) with respect to the seafood processing industry without first consulting with the governor and the labor commissioner of the State in which the alien is to perform such labor.
